property.name: text
property.value: Port 8060

entity.name: CookiesClient
entity.doc: Execute the contained model in a separate thread with optional real-time properties.

svg.text: Make sure there is a director here!

GET /cookies (note: returns generic message since HttpActor only implements session cookies, which are deleted once the browser is closed. In a manual test with the browser left open, this would return a personalized message.)

property.name: correctValues
property.value:
{" Cookies Demo
Welcome to the cookies demo!

You can:

Save a cookie with your name

Please enter a name:

Delete the cookie with your name

Refresh the page for a personalized greeting

"}

property.name: outputActions
property.value: done = true

property.name: text
property.value: If there is a cookie named "name", then customize the page served, otherwise use a generic welcome page.

property.name: text
property.value: For POST requests to http://localhost:8078/cookies, set the cookie named "name" to the value given in the request's parameters

property.name: text
property.value: In this case, the postParameters output contains a record token with only one field, "name". We feed this record back directly to set a cookie named "name".

property.name: text
property.value: GET /cookies

property.name: text
property.value: POST /cookies

property.name: text
property.value: POST cookies/delete

property.name: text
property.value: For POST requests to http://localhost:8078/cookies/delete, send a RecordToken with the label "name" and the value empty string which notifies HttpActor to delete the cookie

property.name: text
property.value: The type of the input port is set to to "{name=string}" to assist type inference.

property.name: text
property.value: This model launches a web server and provides a service available at http://localhost:8078/cookies Please run the model and navigate to that location (or run the model and double click on this comment).

property.name: text
property.value:
Here, we return only a line of text, instead of a complete HTML page. The cookies web page uses an ajax call to /cookies/delete . Ajax is used to insert new data into an existing web page. So, here, we only need the new message.
Ajax is used so that the URL in the browser does not change. We want to keep /cookies , not /cookies/delete , as the URL, so that our cookies will be saved relative to the /cookies URL.

property.name: text
property.value: In HttpActor, specify the name of the cookie to get in the requestedCookies parameter. Here, we look for a cookie called "name".

property.name: text
property.value: To see the list of cookies in your browser, please try: Safari's Web Inspector Storage Navigator (in Developer Tools) Firebug for Firefox: https://getfirebug.com/

property.name: text
property.value: Authors: Elizabeth Latronico, Roxana Gheorghiu, and Edward A. Lee

property.name: text
property.value: The type of the input port is set to to "{name=string}" to assist type inference.

property.name: expression
property.value: "Name " + post.name + " successfully saved as a cookie"

property.name: expression
property.value: (cookies.name == "") ? "Welcome to the cookies demo!" : "Welcome back, " + cookies.name + "!"
